intro: Linanthus jepsonii, commonly known as Jepson's linanthus, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale blue. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in open habitats such as grasslands and woodlands. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain seeds. Linanthus jepsonii is often found in California and is adapted to dry, sunny environments.
